repnme.cdata!:
Djibouti - Social Development and Public
            Works Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Social Development and
            Public Works Project (PDSTP) for Djibouti were as follows:
            outcomes were moderately satisfactory; the risk to
            development outcome was moderate; the Bank's
            performance was moderately satisfactory; and the
            Borrower's performance was also moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: The social and
            environmental assessments and institutional and economic
            analyses are important aspects of project preparation that
            allow a good knowledge of the local conditions and a
            tailored approach. These studies are most useful during
            implementation and can be used to establish the baselines
            for project monitoring. A flexible project design is
            important in a post-conflict situation, in order to adapt to
            the development pace of the country, and in the case of
            PDSTP, the evolution of the executing agency. In a country
            recovering from a severe social conflict and with low
            implementation capacity, like Djibouti, the project targets
            and timetables must be realistic so as to make them
            reasonable to achieve. All the associated risks must be
            flagged up front. It is also advisable to foresee an
            implementation in clear phases that can achieve results at a
            reasonable pace. Community participation is fundamental to
            ensure project ownership, better care of the infrastructure,
            and to motivate change within the beneficiary communities.
            Neighborhood improvement projects should be developed after
            a thorough neighborhood development plan, including
            community participation, is prepared and validated. In the
            case of the PDSTP the use of certain facilities and its care
            and maintenance were below expectations at the beginning of
            the project when the social development component was not
            yet operational. This situation was reversed once the
            communities were involved in project implementation.

repnme.cdata!:
Djibouti - Social Development and Public
            Works Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Social Development
            and Public Works Project is to enhance the living standards
            in Djibouti, through increased access to basic economic and
            social infrastructure, and services, in addition to
            employment generation opportunities. Ultimately, the project
            will contribute to poverty reduction in the city. The
            project includes three components: 1) Social and economic
            infrastructure works will improve the physical environment
            in poor neighborhoods. Mainly, small infrastructure works
            will improve streets and drainage on secondary and tertiary
            networks. Construction/rehabilitation of commercial
            infrastructure, such as markets and public places, will be
            included, in addition to social infrastructure, i.e.,
            standpipes, health posts, schools, and the like. 2) Support
            to community development, complements the works of the first
            component, and will specifically, increase community
            participation in project implementation; and, social
            services will be provided to poor communities, through the
            Social Mobilization Program and the Community Subproject
            Grants, supporting and financing community development
            activities. 3) The third component, will strengthen the
            institutional capacity of stakeholders involved with the
            implementation of the previous two components, through
            poverty monitoring and analysis, and, project management and implementation.

Projet de Developpement Social et de
            Travaux d'Interet Public

repnme.cdata!:
Djibouti - Social Development and Public
            Works Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Social Development
            and Public Works Project is to enhance the living standards
            in Djibouti, through increased access to basic economic and
            social infrastructure, and services, in addition to
            employment generation opportunities. Ultimately, the project
            will contribute to poverty reduction in the city. The
            project includes three components: 1) Social and economic
            infrastructure works will improve the physical environment
            in poor neighborhoods. Mainly, small infrastructure works
            will improve streets and drainage on secondary and tertiary
            networks. Construction/rehabilitation of commercial
            infrastructure, such as markets and public places, will be
            included, in addition to social infrastructure, i.e.,
            standpipes, health posts, schools, and the like. 2) Support
            to community development, complements the works of the first
            component, and will specifically, increase community
            participation in project implementation; and, social
            services will be provided to poor communities, through the
            Social Mobilization Program and the Community Subproject
            Grants, supporting and financing community development
            activities. 3) The third component, will strengthen the
            institutional capacity of stakeholders involved with the
            implementation of the previous two components, through
            poverty monitoring and analysis, and, project management and implementation.
